#!/bin/sh

# Script description: This script does something useful.

# Exit immediately if a command exits with a non-zero status.
set -e

# Treat unset variables as an error when substituting.
set -u

# Stop the script from exiting on errors during pipes.
set -o pipefail

# Define variables
variable1="value1"
variable2="value2"

# Function definitions
function usage {
    echo "Usage: $0 [-options]"
    echo "  -h: Display help/usage information"
    exit 1
}

function cleanup {
    # Code to clean up temporary files or resources
    echo "Cleaning up..."
}

# Trap signals for cleanup operations
trap cleanup EXIT

# Parse command-line arguments
while getopts ":h" opt; do
    case $opt in
        h)
            usage
            ;;
        \?)
            echo "Invalid option: -$OPTARG" >&2
            usage
            ;;
        :)
            echo "Option -$OPTARG requires an argument." >&2
            usage
            ;;
    esac
done

# Main script logic
main() {
    echo "Starting script..."
    echo "Variable 1: $variable1"
    echo "Variable 2: $variable2"

    # Your code goes here
    echo "Doing something..."

    echo "Script finished."
}

# Execute main function
main "$@"

exit 0
